content: this will help hide any color joins i recommend after working a few rounds that you tie a small scrap of yarn on the outside of the work to remind you later that this is the bottom of the fish and don t put the dorsal fin on this side 1 changing colors as desired knit until the body is about 7 long measure on the shortest side of the mouth from the lip/mouth color join 2 after you reach about 7 inches in length work a round and place markers every 11 stitches tie another little scrap of yarn near the bor marker this scrap should be in line with the one you tied on earlier after the lips and will remind you not to put the dorsal fin on this side 3 continue knitting and changing colors as desired until body measures about 8 long remember to measure on the shortest side of the mouth from the lip/mouth color join to the top of the needle 4 go on to the decrease rounds below changing to longer needle for magic loop when necessary hat #43 fish adult size v1 2 decrease rounds stitches divide them evenly onto each needle with 20 on each needle run a rescue row thread through these 40 stitches 20 on each needle and tie the rescue row in a knot by the bor marker work a 3 needle bind off with wrong sides together there is a little mini tutorial at the end to help if you need it picking up for the tail starting at the bor where you tied your rescue row knot and where further down your scraps of yarn are tied and using your tail color yarn pick up 40 stitches 20 on each side here s how i do that 1 take a smaller gauge dpn and carefully pick up one leg of each stitch along one side 20 stitches use your rescue row to help you if needed 2 carefully thread those 20 stitches onto your long circular needle 3 turn the piece
